thread.title: Guardiola promises Arsenal fans will not be stung
thread.title_full: Guardiola promises Arsenal fans will not be stung

title: Guardiola promises Arsenal fans will not be stung
text:
Guardiola promises Arsenal fans will not be stung Wednesday October 21, 2015 Print Article 
Bayern coach Pep Guardiola promised Arsenal fans that ticket costs would not be inflated. ― Reuters pic LONDON, Oct 21 —Bayern Munich coach has vowed Arsenal fans will not face inflated prices when they go to Germany after Bayern supporters protested against Champions League ticket costs at the London side. 
German fans were cheered by their Arsenal counterparts when they staged their demonstration for the first five minutes of today’s game in London which Arsenal won 2-0. 
Arsenal visit Bayern for the return group match on November 4 and Guardiola said after the game: “I will speak with (Arsene) Wenger for next time to make it cheaper for our fans. 
“We will take care of Arsenal fans in Munich with a good price. They can travel,” he added. 
“£64 (RM425) a ticket but without fans football is not worth a penny,” said banners held up at the start of the Champions League game before the German fans took their seats. 
The £64 pound price is one of the highest in the Champions League for average seats. 
Arsenal’s allocation for the next Bayern match is already sold out. — AFP
